Choice.Tooltip: Number of atoms in the molecule having no aromatic bond (excluding hydrogens).
Number of non-aromatic bonds in the molecule (excluding bonds of hydrogen atoms).
Number of atoms in the molecule having aromatic bonds.
Number of aromatic bonds in the molecule.
The number of asymmetric atoms (having four different ligands).
Number of atoms in the molecule including hydrogens.
Number of bonds in the molecule including bonds of hydrogen atoms.
Number of chain atoms (non-ring atoms excluding hydrogens).
Number of chain bonds (non-ring bonds excluding bonds of hydrogen atoms).
The number of tetrahedral stereogenic centers.
Number of ring atoms.
Number of ring bonds.

Number of rotatable bonds in the molecule. Unsaturated bonds, and single bonds connected to hydrogens or terminal atoms, single bonds of amides, sulphonamides and those connecting two hindered aromatic rings (having at least three ortho substituents) are considered non-rotatable.
Number of double bonds with defined stereochemistry.
Number of those rings in the molecule that have non-aromatic bonds (SSSR based).
Number of aromatic rings in the molecule.
Number of aromatic bonds in the molecule.
Number of aliphatic rings containing only carbon atoms (SSSAR based).
Number of aromatic rings containing only carbon atoms (SSSAR based).
Number of aliphatic rings having common bonds with other rings.
Number of aromatic rings having common bonds with other rings.
Number of fused rings in the molecule (having common bonds).
Number of rings containing hetero atom(s).
Number of aliphatic heterocycles in the molecule.
Number of aromatic heterocycles in the molecule.
Size of the largest ring in the molecule.
Number of rings in the largest ring system.
Number of rings in the molecule. This calculation is based on SSSR (Smallest Set of Smallest Rings).
Number of disjunct ring systems.
Size of the smallest ring in the molecule.
Number of rings in the smallest ring system.
Sum of the edge degrees of a molecular graph..
Harmonic sum of the geometric means of the node degrees for each edge.
The Balaban distance connectivity of the molecule, which is the average distance sum connectivity.
The sum of the corresponding row values in the distance matrix for each atom.
The greatest value in the corresponding row of the distance matrix for each atom.
Hhalf-sum of the off-diagonal elements of the reciprocal molecular distance matrix of the molecule.
A variant of the Wiener index.

The Szeged index extends the Wiener index for cyclic graphs by counting the number of atoms on both sides of each bond (those atoms only which are nearer to the given side of the bond than to the other), and sum these counts.
The average topological atom distance (half of the sum of all atom distances) in the molecule.
The number of 3 bond length distances in the molecule.
The smallest number of bonds which must be removed so that no circuit remains. Also known as circuit rank.
Number of fragments (disconnected parts) in the molecule.
Topological steric effect index (TSEI) of an atom calculated from the covalent radii values and topological distances. The stericEffectIndex is related to the steric hindrance of the given atom.

Boolean.Label: Single fragment mode
Boolean.Tooltip: If unchecked (default), the calculation handles unlinked molecules together, if checked, the results are displayed separately.
